thing-type.label: ZW100 MultiSensor 6
thing-type.description: MultiSensor 6<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtTechnical Specifications</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtBattery or USB powered PIR motion sensor, operating distance: Up to 500 feet/150 metres outdoors.</li&gt <li&gtOperating temperature: 0°C to 40°C</li&gt <li&gtRelative humidity: 8% RH to 80% RH</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtClick one time:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtSend non-security Node Info Frame</li&gt <li&gtAdd MultiSensor into Z-wave network (non security inclusion)</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtShort press 2 times within 1 second:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtSend Security Node Info Frame</li&gt <li&gtAdd Multisensor into Z-Wave network (security inclusion)</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtClick one time:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtSend non-security Node Info Frame</li&gt <li&gtRemove MultiSensor from Z-wave network</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtShort press 2 times within 1 second:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtSend Security Node Info Frame</li&gt <li&gtRemove MultiSensor from network</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtClick one time:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtSend non-security Node Info Frame</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtShort press 2 times within 1 second:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtSend Security Node Info Frame</li&gt </ul&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Stay Awake in Battery Mode
parameter.description: Stay awake for 10 minutes at power on<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable/Disable waking up for 10 minutes when re-power on (battery mode) the MultiSensor.<br /&gt1. Value = 0, disable.<br /&gt2. Value =others, enable.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_2
parameter.label: 3: Motion Sensor reset timeout
parameter.description: Motion Sensor reset timeout<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ol&gt<li&gtThe default PIR time is 4 minutes. The Multisensor will send BASIC SET CC (0x00) to the associated nodes if no motion is triggered again in 4 minutes.</li&gt <li&gtRange: 10~3600.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNote</strong&gt:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtThe time unit is second if the value range is in 10 to 255.</li&gt <li&gtIf the value range is in 256 to 3600, the time unit will be minute and its value should follow the below rules:<br /&gta), Interval time =Value/60, if the interval time can be divided by 60 and without remainder.<br /&gtb), Interval time= (Value/60) +1, if the interval time can be divided by 60 and has remainder.</li&gt <li&gtOther values will be ignored.</li&gt </ol&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Motion sensor sensitivity
parameter.description: Sensitivity level of PIR sensor (1=minimum, 5=maximum)

parameter.name: config_39_1
parameter.label: 39: Low Battery Report
parameter.description: Report Low Battery if below this value<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtConfigure low battery value.<br /&gtValue=10 to 50.(10% to 50%)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: Selective Reporting
parameter.description: Select to report on thresholds<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable/disable the selective reporting only when measurements reach a certain threshold or percentage set in 41-44 below. This is used to reduce network traffic. (0 == disable, 1 == enable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_41_2
parameter.label: 41: Temperature Threshold
parameter.description: Temperature change threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThreshold change in temperature to induce an automatic report.<br /&gt<strong&gtNote</strong&gt:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtThe unit is Fahrenheit for US version, Celsius for EU/AU version.</li&gt <li&gtThe value contains one decimal point. E.g. if the value is set to 20, the threshold value =2.0°C (EU/AU version) or 2.0 °F (US version). When the current temperature gap is more then 2.0, which will induce a temperature report to be sent out.</li&gt </ol&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_42_1
parameter.label: 42: Humidity Threshold
parameter.description: Humidity percent change threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThreshold change in humidity to induce an automatic report.<br /&gtNote:<br /&gt1. The unit is %.<br /&gt2. The default value is 10, which means that if the current humidity gap is<br /&gtmore than 10%, it will send out a humidity report.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_43_2
parameter.label: 43: Luminance Threshold
parameter.description: Luminance change threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThreshold change in luminance to induce an automatic report.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_44_1
parameter.label: 44: Battery Threshold
parameter.description: Battery level threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThreshold change in battery level to induce an automatic report.</p&gt <p&gtNote:<br /&gt1. The unit is %.<br /&gt2. The default value is 10, which means that if the current battery level gap is<br /&gtmore than 10%, it will send out a battery report.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_45_1
parameter.label: 45: Ultraviolet Threshold
parameter.description: Ultraviolet change threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThreshold change in ultraviolet to induce an automatic report.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_46_1
parameter.label: 46: Send Alarm Report if low temperature
parameter.description: Send an alarm report if temperature is less than -15 °C

parameter.name: config_100_1_wo
parameter.label: 100: Set parameters 101-103 to default.
parameter.description: Reset 101-103 to defaults<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet 101-103 to default.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_101_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 101: Group 1 Periodic Reports
parameter.description: Periodic reports to send to Group 1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis value is a combination number made up of the sum of the values for the individual sensors and battery. The sensors have these values:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtBattery=1</li&gt <li&gtUltraviolet=16</li&gt <li&gtTemperature=32</li&gt <li&gtHumidity=64</li&gt <li&gtLight=128</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt1+16+32+64+128 = 241 and is the default value</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_102_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 102: Group 2 Periodic Reports
parameter.description: Periodic reports to send to Group 2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis value is a combination number made up of the sum of the values for the individual sensors and battery. The sensors have these values:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtBattery=1</li&gt <li&gtUltraviolet=16</li&gt <li&gtTemperature=32</li&gt <li&gtHumidity=64</li&gt <li&gtLight=128</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_103_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 103: Group 3 Periodic Reports
parameter.description: Periodic reports to send to Group 3<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis value is a combination number made up of the sum of the values for the individual sensors and battery. The sensors have these values:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtBattery=1</li&gt <li&gtUltraviolet=16</li&gt <li&gtTemperature=32</li&gt <li&gtHumidity=64</li&gt <li&gtLight=128</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_110_1_wo
parameter.label: 110: Set parameters 111-113 to default.
parameter.description: Set parameters 111-113 to default.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet parameters 111-113 to default. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_111_4
parameter.label: 111: Group 1 Report Interval
parameter.description: How often to update Group 1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time of sending reports in Report group 1 (Valid values 0x05-0x28DE80).</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtThe unit of interval time is second if USB power.</li&gt <li&gtIf battery power, the minimum interval time is 60 minutes by default, for example, if the value is set to be more than 5 and less than 3600, the interval time is 60 minutes, if the value is set to be more than 3600 and less than 7200, the interval time is 120 minutes. You can also change the minimum interval time to 4 minutes via setting the interval value(3 bytes) to 240 in Wake Up Interval Set CC.</li&gt </ol&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_112_4
parameter.label: 112: Group 2 Report Interval
parameter.description: Group 2 Report Interval<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time of sending reports in Report group 2 (Valid values 0x05-<br /&gt0x28DE80).<br /&gtNote:<br /&gt1. The unit of interval time is second if USB power.<br /&gt2. If battery power, the minimum interval time is 60 minutes by default, for<br /&gtexample, if the value is set to be more than 5 and less than 3600, the interval<br /&gttime is 60 minutes, if the value is set to be more than 3600 and less than 7200,<br /&gtthe interval time is 120 minutes. You can also change the minimum interval time<br /&gtto 4 minutes via setting the interval value(3 bytes) to 240 in Wake Up Interval Set<br /&gtCC.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_113_4
parameter.label: 113: Group 3 Report Interval
parameter.description: Group 3 Report Interval<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time of sending reports in Report group 3</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtThe unit of interval time is second if USB power.</li&gt <li&gtIf battery power, the minimum interval time is 60 minutes by default, for example, if the value is set to be more than 5 and less than 3600, the interval time is 60 minutes, if the value is set to be more than 3600 and less than 7200, the interval time is 120 minutes. You can also change the minimum interval time to 4 minutes via setting the interval value(3 bytes) to 240 in Wake Up Interval Set CC.</li&gt </ol&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_201_1
parameter.label: 201: Temperature Calibration
parameter.description: Temperature calibration in 0.1 deg steps<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTemperature calibration (the available value range is [-100,100] or [-10°C ,10 °C ] ).<br /&gt<strong&gtNote</strong&gt:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtThe value contains one decimal point. E.g. if the value is set to 20, the calibration value is 2.0°C (EU/AU version) or 2.0 °F (US version)</li&gt <li&gtThe calibration value = standard value - measure value. °C and the standard value = 23.2 °C , so the calibration value= 23.2 °C - 25.3 °C = -2.1 °C (0xEB).</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gt<br /&gtIf the measure value =30.1 °C and the standard value = 33.2 °C , so the calibration value= 33.2 °C - 30.1 °C =3.1 °C (0x1F).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_202_1
parameter.label: 202: Humidity Sensor Calibration
parameter.description: Humidity Sensor Calibration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtHumidity sensor calibration (the available value range is [-50, 50]).<br /&gtThe calibration value = standard value - measure value.<br /&gtE.g. If measure value =80RH and the standard value = 75RH, so the calibration<br /&gtvalue= 75RH – 80RH= -5RH (0xFB).<br /&gtIf the measure value =85RH and the standard value = 90RH, so the calibration<br /&gtvalue= 90RH – 85RH=5RH (0x05).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_203_2
parameter.label: 203: Luminance Sensor Calibration
parameter.description: Luminance Sensor Calibration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtLuminance sensor calibration (the available value range is [-1000, 1000]).<br /&gtThe calibration value = standard value - measure value.<br /&gtE.g. If measure value =800Lux and the standard value = 750Lux, so the<br /&gtcalibration value= 750 – 800= -50 (0xFFCE).<br /&gtIf the measure value =850Lux and the standard value = 900Lux, so the calibration<br /&gtvalue= 900 – 850=50 (0x0032).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_204_1
parameter.label: 204: Ultraviolet Sensor Calibration
parameter.description: Ultraviolet Sensor Calibration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtUltraviolet sensor calibration (the available value range is [-10, 10]).<br /&gtThe calibration value = standard value - measure value.<br /&gtE.g. If measure value =9 and the standard value = 8, so the calibration value= 8 –<br /&gt9= -1 (0xFE).<br /&gtIf the measure value =7 and the standard value = 9, so the calibration value= 9 –<br /&gt7=2 (0x02).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_252_1
parameter.label: 252: Disable/Enable Configuration Lock
parameter.description: Disable/Enable Configuration Lock (0=Disable, 1=Enable)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnable/disable Configuration Locked (0 =disable, 1 = enable).</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Resets all configuration parameters to defaults
Reset to default factory settings and be excluded
